definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: I forbid you to make a sortie today.
Waiting for a fight, waiting for a rewarding experience of the attack.
sentences.chinese: 等待着一场战斗，等待着一次满载而归的出击。

sentences.english: The best jobseekers are and don't wait.
sentences.chinese: 最好的求职者从来不坐等其成，而是主动出击。

sentences.english: I think his determination to come for crosses is calm but commanding.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他在出击传中球上很冷静而且很坚决。

sentences.english: The larva takes aim at the snail's tentacles. It strikes with its poison nippers.
sentences.chinese: 小萤火虫瞄准了蜗牛的触角，并用自己带毒的螯出击。

sentences.english: Try to look at as many as you can before you formulate your plan of attack.
sentences.chinese: 在筹谋出击计划之前，尽量多看看。

sentences.english: Be aggressive; be the one to resign, if you have the guts.
sentences.chinese: 主动出击，主动辞职，只要你有勇气。

sentences.english: Wolf hunting, always the team attack, all do their bit.
sentences.chinese: 狼在捕猎时，总是团队出击，各尽其位。

sentences.english: Sooty skyshatter back to attack, and stone is also be of both.
sentences.chinese: 黑子和石破天背对出击，他们也处于被夹攻当中。

sentences.english: Time enough for one last sortie.
sentences.chinese: 时间足以让一个最后的出击。

sentences.english: On the third night the soldiers sallied forth and broke the siege.
sentences.chinese: 第三天夜里，士兵们向敌人出击，突破了包围。

sentences.english: At the Third Plenary Session in 1950, I spoke against hitting out in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 一九五零年，我在三中全会上说过，不要四面出击。

sentences.english: Once they sense an employee's soft spot, they pounce on it.
sentences.chinese: 他们嗅到员工的软肋，就会重拳出击。

sentences.english: They decided to wage a war of attrition rather than to rely on an all-out attack.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定打一场消耗战，而不搞全线出击。

sentences.english: Here, in the brightening morning sky, Typhoons are prepared for the first sortie of the day.
sentences.chinese: 在明亮的早晨，人们正在为当天的第一次出击作准备。

sentences.english: Because its drilling launches an attack often by long sleeve Tibet, therefore calls "the long sleeve fist".
sentences.chinese: 因其演练出击时常以长袖藏手，故又称“长袖拳”。

definition: to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
sudden and violent attack/assault/fig. rushed job/concentrated effort to finish a job quickly
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
